result.execSummary:
The defendant Katherine M Zurcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Bail applied to cost.  Paid in full.  Balance to be refunded to poster.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Follow all rules of Waukesha County DTC.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Katherine M Zurcher in court with attorney Maura A McMahon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00; cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  Follow all rules of Waukesha County DTC.
